name: Fractured Coffee Break Quiz / Test | Fractured Words | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
espresso.

	Hermann Hesse (1877-1962) was a German novelist and poet. A Nobel laureate for literature, he wrote "Siddhartha," "Narcissus and Goldmund," "Demian," "Steppenwolf," and many other works. When I was a teenager EVERYONE was reading Hesse--it was a kind of cult. Espresso, which is made by forcing steaming hot water through finely-ground coffee, is usually served in a demitasse with sugar and/or a lemon twist. It's very strong.

cappuccino.

	The word CAPPUCCINO means "little monk's hood" in Italian. This coffee drink consists of one shot of espresso topped with a "hood" of steamed milk foam. Often the foam is topped with a sprinkling of cinnamon, powdered chocolate, or both. Cappuccinos usually come in thick china cups placed on saucers.

Starbucks & Starbuck's.

	These days, in San Francisco anyway, it seems like there is at least one Starbucks per block. My favorite drink there is the vanilla latte. Very fattening and expensive.

barista & barrista.

	The barista is the guy or gal who makes espresso drinks at Starbucks, Peets, and the myriad other coffee bars that exist in the world.

cafe latte & caffe latte.

	CAFE LATTE means "coffee milk." A regular latte usually consists of one shot of expresso and about a cup and a half of steamed, foamy milk in a tall thick glass. If you pour the espresso in nice and slowly (following the milk), the drink will separate into three stripes: a white one at the top, a beige one in the middle, and a darker one at the bottom.

double espresso.

	I don't know how people can drink these. I wouldn't be able to sleep for two days.

cafe au lait.

	Cafe au lait (coffee with milk) is the French version of a caffe latte. It's less foamy and sometimes smaller than a latte. It may come in a bowl.

macchiato.

	A macchiato is an espresso with a little bit of foamy steamed milk on top.

double cappuccino.

	As I'm sure you know, this is a cappuccino with two shots of espresso. Again--how can people handle this much caffeine?

demitasse & demi-tasse.

	In French this means "half cup," but most demitasses are even littler than that.

French roast.

	French roast coffee beans have been roasted long enough so that the oil rises to the beans' surface.

cream and sugar.

	The Cree people are native North Americans who lived and live in eastern Canada and in the north eastern U.S. Their name comes from "Kristineaux," a name given them by French fur traders, who called them "Kri" for short. These days most of us use half and half or milk. My favorite kind of sugar for coffee is raw sugar cubes. Second favorite is light brown raw sugar granules in packets.

coffee shop.

	In the U.S., a coffee shop is an informal family-type restaurant that's one step up from a fast food place. Denny's is a famous chain of coffee shops.

nonfat latte & non-fat latte.

	For those on diets.
